commits.comment: added an initial implementation of a file monitor; that watches the deploy directory for jars to deploy, config files to change or expanded bundles (which are then turned into a bundle and deployed)

created a new runtime subdirectory; moved the main module in there -and also created a minimal servicemix distro (which hopefully we can reuse across each binary distro). Also added Camel to the distro

created a new runtime subdirectory; moved the main module in there -and also created a minimal servicemix distro (which hopefully we can reuse across each binary distro). Also added Camel to the distro

created a new runtime subdirectory; moved the main module in there -and also created a minimal servicemix distro (which hopefully we can reuse across each binary distro). Also added Camel to the distro
added some link love to Peter Kriens who's FileInstall was an inspiration for the filemonitor idea
added some link love to Peter Kriens who's FileInstall was an inspiration for the filemonitor idea
Add servicemix.bat to the distributions
Ignore target directories
Use servicemix file monitor instead of pax-confman
attempt to reduce some wierdness of the file monitor by using canonical paths to compare file paths with the deployed bundles etc
only refresh the changed packages
patch so that all bundles are installed/reinstalled first before they are started/updated so that adding a feature (a set of inter-dependent bundles) works fine

added a simple features option to make it easy to install, say, Camel either statically in a build or dynamically by unzipping a zip of the required bundles. Also added some handy shell scripts to test adding a feature / camel example - until we've got better tooling to make this easy
Add OBR bundele and related gshell commands
Add GShell to the runtime
Move GShell to runtime
Change config dir to etc to align with gshell which is not extensible
Use servicemix obr repo
Fix gshell layout, add osgi/install command, remove delay before starting gshell
- The main boot strap now registers a MainService object so that other bundles can find out what the command line arguments were.
Updated the MainService interface so that the exit code can be passed back.  We now shutdown the system when teh GShell is exited.
- Better Exit Support  - We now try to wait for the framework to initialize before starting up the shell.  This is still having some problems
modified the svn:ignores
Add gshell remote support
Fix the remote console
Implements subshells and use a dynamic layout
Another way of doing subshells.  This time we actually create a whole new DefaultShell for the sub shell.
Improve subshells a bit
Improve subshells a bit
Use non patched mina version and fix the remote shell closing
Added support for a startup.properties file which can provide more explict control over the run-level and what is started from the system directroy
Filtering the startup.properties now
Isolate ServiceMix Runtime
Rename minimum to assembly, add runtime in main package, add ASL headers
Set svn:ignore
Add some missing headers
Add a dependencyManagement section to avoid using several versions of the same libs
Reorg svn tree
Move OBR repo
Remove unneeded repos

Updated the servicemix main so that in addition to the servicemix.home it also looks for a servicemix.base which defaults the the servicemix.home value.  servicemix.base is used as the base directroy for all data and config instance files.
Updated configs so that they use the servicemix.base variable
Updated config so that instance system directory does not need to exist also update windows bat file to that it can be used per instance too.
Added eclipse-classes to svn:ignores
Add some ASF headers, create release profile, remove unneeded repos

refactored the release directory so that you can add platform specific file without having to update the assembly descriptors.  Made the final distributions slightly smaller by making the .zip file Windows specific and the .tar.gz unix specific.
removed .sh extensions since it's now obvious that this is the only execuable in the dir
Adding a create command that allows you to create servicemix instance configuration.
Fix typo
Fix JSW scripts and other things
Moved the java service wrapper into it's own OSGI bundle that folks can optionally install
adding ignores
Fixed it up so that it works on windows too.  Renamed the service wrapper stuff to servicemix-wrapper.exe so that it's easy to spot as the servicemix proecess in a running task manager.
Made the executeable names be based on the name specified
Add commands hooks
Specify init and destroy methods so that the repo is set by default
We now chmod the linux/mac executables and provide better service install help.
Fix features repo url
Moved the servicemix.jar to the lib dir.  Fixed the create command so that it chmods that servicemix shell file a+x
Add version in the bundle name
Fix bad message when command is not found
Reduced intial amount of logging
Add testing modules
Add testing modules

Fix test support

Fix windows binary distribution
Do not rely on spring internals, use felix as the default platform
